functions.name: group
functions.description:
Groups items in an array in groups of a specified size.

Example: group([0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0], 2) => [[0, 0], [0, 0], [0, 0]].

params.name: groupSize
params.description: The size of the groups.

functions.name: groupBy
functions.description:
Groups an array by callback checks.

If an item falls under 2 groups, it will go into the group that comes first.

functions.name: mapProperty
functions.description: Maps an object by a property.

functions.name: is
functions.description: Checks if the provided thing is parsable as boolean.

functions.name: parse
functions.description:
Parses a resolvable boolean.
Returns null if it is not a boolean.

functions.name: isTrue
functions.description: Checks if a resolvable boolean is true.

functions.name: isFalse
functions.description: Checks if a resolvable boolean is false.

functions.name: difference
functions.description: Gets the difference between two dates. (in milliseconds)

params.name: date1
params.description: The first date.

params.name: date2
params.description:
The second date.

Defaults to the current date if not provided.

functions.name: parseRelativeString
functions.description: Gets the date from the provided relative string.

functions.name: isDate
functions.description: Checks if the resolvable is a date.

params.name: options
params.description: The options for the element.

params.name: options.tag
params.description: The element tag.

params.name: options.id
params.description: The element id.

params.name: options.parent
params.description: The element parent.

params.name: options.class
params.description: The element class.

params.name: options.draggable
params.description: Whether the element is draggable.

functions.name: applyRange
functions.description: Applies a range to a number.

params.name: value
params.description: The value to apply the range to.

params.name: min
params.description: The minimum/lowest number in the range.

params.name: max
params.description: The maximum/highest number in the range.

functions.name: inRange
functions.description: Checks if a number is in the specified range.

params.name: value
params.description: The value to test.

params.name: min
params.description: The minimum/lowest number in the range.

params.name: max
params.description: The maximum/highest number in the range.

functions.name: flipRange
functions.description: Returns the number on the opposite side of the range.

params.name: value
params.description: The value.

params.name: min
params.description: The minimum/lowest number in the range.

params.name: max
params.description: The maximum/highest number in the range.

functions.name: addPropertyNonCircular
functions.description: Adds a property while avoiding circular properties.

functions.name: isJSON
functions.description: Checks if a string is parsable as a JSON object.

functions.name: limit
functions.description: Limits the string to the specified size.

functions.name: chop
functions.description: Chops a string into strings of a specified length.

functions.name: removeEndingElipsis
functions.description: Removes the elpisis (...) at the end of a string.

functions.name: evenlySpace
functions.description:
Attempts to evenly space strings.
(only really works with monospace fonts)

you must put `$SPACE$` where you want the space to be

##### example:
```js
[ "key$SPACE$value", "examplekey$SPACE$examplevalue" ]
```

params.name: options.alignKey
params.description:
The direction to align the keys.

Default is `"left"`

params.name: options.minimumSpacing
params.description:
The minimum amount of spaces between the key and the value.

Default is `1`.

welcome.name: Welcome
welcome.content: # meltyutils Various utilities that can be used for any projects! ## Downloading ### CDN with jsDelivr Add MeltyUtils into your web applications with [jsDelivr](https://www.jsdelivr.com) ```html
